column3: Test Description
Verify that an Admin user can successfully add a new main category (parent category) to the system.
column5:
1.  Go to the categories tab.
2.  Click on “Add a Category” Button
3.  select different category Except “Main Category”
4.  Click on Save button.
column6:
1. Navigated to category list. 
2. Category list is updated with new one 
3. Shows the success message.

column3: Verify that an Admin user can successfully add a new sub-category by selecting an existing parent category.
column5:
1. Go to the categories tab. 
2. Click on “Add a Category” Button 
3. select different category Except “Main Category” 
4. Click on Save button.
column6:
1. Navigated to category list. 
2. Sub Category list is updated with new one. 
3. Shows the success message.

column3: Verify that the system displays a validation error message when the Category Name field is left empty during creation.
column5:
1. Go to the categories tab. 
2. Click on “Add a Category” Button 
3. Keep the Category Name as Empty. 
4. Click on Save Button.
column6: 1.Error should be shown as “Category name is required”

column2: Verify Validation: Category Name Length (lower limit validation)
column3: Verify that the system displays a validation error message when the Category Name entered is shorter than the minimum required length (3 characters).
column5:
1. Go to the categories tab. 
2. Click on “Add a Category” Button
3. Enter Category name (name length < 3)
4. Click on Save Button.
column6: 1. Error should be shown as “Category name must be between 3 and 10 characters”

column2: Verify Validation: Category Name Length (Upper limit validation)
column3: Verify that the system displays a validation error message when the Category Name entered is longer than the maximum required length (10 characters).
column5:
1. Go to the categories tab. 
2. Click on “Add a Category” Button
3. Enter Category name (name length > 10)
4. Click on Save Button.
column6: 1. Error should be shown as “Category name must be between 3 and 10 characters”

column3: Verify that clicking the Cancel button on the category creation page navigates the user back to the category list without saving changes.
column5:
1. Go to the categories tab. 
2. Click on “Add a Category” Button. 
3. Click on Cancel Button.

column2: Verify Test User View Category List
column3: Verify that a standard Test User can view the list of categories
column6: 1. Display list of categories with pagination.

column3: Verify that a Test User can successfully search for a specific category by name using the search functionality.
column5:
1. Go to the Categories tab. 
2. Enter Search keyword in the input box. 
3. Click on the search box.

column2: Verify Add Button Hidden for Test User
column3: Verify that the "Add Category" button is hidden for Test User.
column5:
1. Go to the Categories tab. 
2. Check for the “Add Category” button.

column2: Verify Delete button disabled or hidden for Test User.
column3: Verify that the "Delete" button is disabled or hidden for Test User in the category list.
column5:
1. Go to the Categories tab. 
2. Check for delete icon on a row.
column6: 1. The delete button is disabled or hidden.

column2: Verify 'No category found' shown when entering a irrelevant text for category name
column3: Verify that the system displays a "No category found" message when a user searches for a category name that does not exist.
column5:
1. Go to the Categories tab. 
2. Search irrelevant text on the textbox.

column3: Verify that the API allows an Admin to create a new category with valid data
Verify that the API allows an Admin to update an existing category's details
Verify that the API allows an Admin to delete an existing category by its ID

column2: Creating category with less than 3 letters for name
column3: Verify that the API returns a validation error (400 Bad Request) when creating a category with a name shorter than 3 characters.
Verify that the API returns a validation error (400 Bad Request) when the name field is missing in the payload.

column2: get all sub categories as Test User
column3: Verify that a Test User can retrieve the list of all sub categories via the API (GET request).

column2: Get specific category by ID for Test User
column3: Verify that a Test User can retrieve details of a specific category by its ID via the API (GET request).
Verify that the API denies a Test User from creating a new category (POST request) and returns 403 Forbidden.
Verify that the API denies a Test User from updating an existing category (PUT request) and returns 403 Forbidden.
Verify that the API denies a Test User from deleting a category (DELETE request) and returns 403 Forbidden.
